TopicTitle: Can we have multiple KSP games/installs on one PC?

Articles.Content:
Hi!

I'm just wondering if we can have multiple KSP games/installs on one PC. (One stock, one modded, on RSS/RO/RP-1, etc.)

Do we just have to duplicate the Kerbal Space Program folder?

Can CKAN manage them?

Thanks!

1. Yes.

2. Yes.

3. Yes.

I currently have 5 installs, some for testing, some for stock gameplay, one for my main modded save. This works from the KSP store, GOG, and Steam. CKAN can handle this easily, there is a button in the top left IIRC to change the which install it's handling.

1 hour ago, Clamp-o-Tron said:

1. Yes.

2. Yes.

3. Yes.

Some even say we must.

Just copy the whole "Kerbal Space Program" directory tree and put a link to the KSP executable on your desktop (or wherever you can most easily find it). KSP decides which directory to use by the place the executable was in when it was started.
Thank you everyone for your wonderful suggestions! I really need separate KSP installs for modded and stock games so I don't have to install and uninstall my mods repeatedly.
